questions.question: Who expressed the belief that racism would end as blacks acquired economic value to society?

choices.answer: Booker T. Washington
Ida B. Wells
William Torrey Harris
W.E.B. DuBois

questions.question: An example of patronage would be:

choices.answer: assassinating a public official
saying one thing and doing another
appointing a friend to a political position
bribing a government official

questions.question: Woodrow Wilson's "Triple Wall of Privilege" included all of the following EXCEPT:

choices.answer: high finance
inherited wealth
tariffs
trusts

questions.question: Tammany Hall was the name of:

choices.answer: a New York Customs house
a federal courthouse in New York City
a famous settlement house
a New York City political machine

questions.question: The Progressive movement regarded all of the following as worthy goals EXCEPT

choices.answer: protecting social welfare
creating economic reform
promoting business monopolies
fostering efficiency in the workplace

questions.question: Which of the following is TRUE of the Gentlemen's Agreement?

choices.answer: it decreased Japanese immigration
it resulted in segregated classrooms
it caused anti-American rioting in Japan
it prohibited aliens from working in industrial jobs

questions.question: Which effect can be traced directly to the Supreme Court's ruling in Plessy v. Ferguson (1896)?

choices.answer: Race riots broke out in New York and other large cities
Racial segregation was permitted for nearly 60 years
Southern blacks lost their voting rights for 60 years
Lynching of African Americans continued into the 1920s

questions.question: The MAIN goal of the Americanization movement was to:

choices.answer: limit the number of immigrants entering the country
assimilate people of various cultures into the main culture
improve the living conditions in America's largest cities
encourage people to move from the country to the city

questions.question: Which of the following best states the primary goal of prohibitionists?

choices.answer: to eliminate the sale of alcohol to minors
to eliminate the use of alcohol in society
to reduce the availability of alcohol to minors
to reduce accidents in the workplace

questions.question: Settlement houses were founded in the late-1800s by:

choices.answer: political machines
social reformers
new immigrants
industrial workers

questions.question: The main immigration processing station in San Francisco was called:

choices.answer: Angel Island
Tammany Hall
Hull House
Ellis Island

questions.question: Which of the following muckrakers is NOT correctly matched with their work?

choices.answer: Jacob Riis: How the Other Half Lives
Lincoln Steffens: The Shame of the Cities
Ida Tarbell: The History of the Standard Oil Co.
Ida B. Wells: The Jungle

questions.question: The main goal of the Chinese Exclusion Act was to:

choices.answer: stop Chinese Americans from attending school in the U.S.
settle a disagreement between China and the U.S.
decrease Chinese immigration
create segregated classrooms

questions.question: Publication of The Jungle (1906) helped lead to the passage of which two acts?

choices.answer: Sherman Antitrust Act and the Clayton Antitrust Act
Pure Food and Drug Act and the Meat Inspection Act
Consumer Protection Act and the Poison-Free Act
Interstate Commerce Act and the Worker's Compensation Act

questions.question: Which of the following was NOT used by female suffragists to obtain their goal?

choices.answer: Calling for female workers to strike
Convincing state legislatures to grant women voting rights
Advocating a constitutional amendment
Testing the 14th Amendment in court

questions.question: The cartoon illustrates President Theodore Roosevelt's attempt to:

choices.answer: limit the power of monopolies
ignore antitrust laws
eliminate foreign ownership of U.S. corporations
conserve natural resources

questions.question: The Pendleton Civil Service Act required

choices.answer: cities to provide services such as clean water to residents
native-born Americans to treat immigrants with courtesy
applicants for government jobs to pass examinations
government workers to renounce all party loyalties

questions.question: Jim Crow laws were laws that

choices.answer: taxed voters
denied citizenship to Asian immigrants
promoted discrimination against women
separated the races

questions.question: In the case Plessy v. Ferguson, the Supreme Court ruled that:

choices.answer: lynching was a federal crime
school segregation was unconstitutional
racial segregation in public facilities was legal
voting rights could not be tied to any form of tax

questions.question: In The Jungle (1906), Upton Sinclair exposed

choices.answer: illegal deals between special interests and the government
unsanitary conditions in the meat-packing industry
dangers faced by coal miners
corrupt business practices of the Standard Oil Company

questions.question: The primary goal of the NAACP was:

choices.answer: voting rights for women
equality among the races
better working conditions
regulation of the banking industry

questions.question: Nativism is:

choices.answer: overt favoritism toward Native Americans
overt favoritism toward the native-born people of a country
an ideology that favors a multi-ethnic society
an anti-Native American movement

questions.question: Which statement best characterizes Teddy Roosevelt's position on trusts?

choices.answer: trusts were of benefit to the public interest
all trusts should be busted
some trusts were harmful to the public interest
trusts were legal and could not be abolished

questions.question: William "Boss" Tweed was:

choices.answer: a Robber Baron
known for his tweed suits, which were boss
a city boss for the NYC political machine
a Social Gospel reformer

questions.question: Which of the following choices BEST defines the term "Social Darwinism?"

choices.answer: a belief in govt ownership of the means of production
an ideology that opposes all forms of national government
an ideology emphasizing a global workers' revolution
belief that humans compete for economic and social survival

questions.question: Which of the following BEST defines the ideology of anarchism?

choices.answer: a political theory opposing all forms of national government
favors government ownership of the means of production
a market-based system where companies/people run the economy
an ideology calling for a global workers' revolution

questions.question: Which of the following was NOT a success of the Progressive movement?

choices.answer: installing the secret ballot
passing nationwide equal pay for equal work laws
instituting referendum, recall, and initiative measures
instituting direct primaries and direct election of Senators

questions.question: Which of the following BEST describes the goals of the American Federation of Labor (AFL)?

choices.answer: to obtain better conditions for workers in its unions
to install a socialist instead of a capitalist society
to help immigrants obtain citizenship
to unite skilled and unskilled workers in a single union

questions.question: Collective Bargaining was a technique used to

choices.answer: expand industry
restrict labor unions
win workers' rights
organize labor unions

questions.question: The Sherman Anti-Trust Act

choices.answer: outlawed the formation of trusts
the adoption of equal wages for men and women
was supported by millionaire industrialists
changes in local labor law for women and children

questions.question: Which of the following represents an important consequence of the Haymarket Riot?

choices.answer: the decline of the Knights of Labor
the victory of workers in the Homestead Strike
an increase in public support for strikes
the break-up of the American Federation of Labor (AFL)

questions.question: Why did the govt generally sympathize with business owners against labor in the late-19th c.?

choices.answer: businesses = $$$ and the govt adhered to laissez-faire ideas
govt leaders did not think working conditions were that bad
govt leaders in this period were Socialists
the govt feared violence from business leaders

questions.question: Which of the following resulted from the Triangle Shirtwaist factory fire?

choices.answer: the imprisonment of company officials
the passage of the Sherman Anti-Trust Act
changes in labor laws for women and children
equal wages for men and women

questions.question: Which of the following was NOT a reaction to increased immigration in the GAPE?

choices.answer: hostility from "old" immigrants toward "new" immigrants
nativism and demands to restrict immigration to the US
the "melting pot" theory and Americanization movement
forced segregation of "new" immigrants into certain cities

questions.question: Which of the following was NOT a characteristic of Progressive Era race relations?

choices.answer: widespread lynchings of ethnic and racial minorities
race riots and discrimination against "new" immigrants
the rejection of scientific racism and Social Darwinism
Jim Crow laws and black voter suppression in the South

questions.question: Which of the following was NOT a Progressive Era President?

choices.answer: Eugene Debs
William Howard Taft
Theodore Roosevelt
Woodrow Wilson

questions.question: Which of the following was NOT intended to give everyday citizens a greater voice in govt?

choices.answer: voter initiative
18th Amendment
voter referendum
17th Amendment

questions.question: What is a muckraker?

choices.answer: a climate change activist
an anti-immigrant activist
an investigative journalist
a corrupt politician

questions.question: What kind of treatment could immigrants expect at Angel Island and Ellis Island?

choices.answer: access to free food, clothing, and a jobs program
a research program to document each immigrant's story
medical exams, lines, detainment, and maybe name changes
access to low-cost rentals throughout a variety of cities

questions.question: Which of the following sets of terms correctly describes elements of the Haymarket Affair?

choices.answer: 1877; Railroads; Knights of Labor
1892; Pullman; railcars; Interstate Commerce; Debs
1886; Chicago; Anarchists, labor violence, police deaths
1902: Coal Strike; peaceful end negotiated by Roosevelt
